article_title: A Market-Based Alternative To The $750 Pill

article_metadata.description: You probably saw the headlines. Daraprim is a small, white tablet that looks a lot like Aspirin. It was created 62 year ago and treats a parasitic infection called toxoplasmosis. Until recently is sold for $13.50. But then Turing Pharmaceuticals acquired the only company that manufacturers the drug and it [...]
article_metadata.author: John C. Goodman
